article.title: Effects of neutrino mass hierarchies on dynamical dark energy models

multiple_choice_question.text: The figure shows confidence-level contour plots for the CPL parametrization. Which parameter shows the most significant variation depending on different neutrino mass hierarchies?
Based on the figure, what is the approximate 95% CL upper limit on the sum of neutrino masses (Σm<sub>ν</sub>) for the Inverted Hierarchy (IH) scenario in the CPL model?

This figure presents contour plots for the logarithmic parametrization.  Which statement best describes the impact of varying neutrino mass hierarchies on the DE parameters (w<sub>0</sub> and w<sub>1</sub>) in this model?
choices: Significant variations are observed for both w<sub>0</sub> and w<sub>1</sub>.
No significant variations are observed in the full parameter space, including DE properties.
w<sub>0</sub> shows significant variation, while w<sub>1</sub> remains almost constant.
w<sub>1</sub> shows significant variation, while w<sub>0</sub> remains almost constant.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the logarithmic model, what is the approximate 2σ (95% CL) upper bound on Σm<sub>ν</sub> for the Normal Hierarchy (NH) scenario?
This figure compares the CMB TT power spectrum for CPL, logarithmic, and JBP models with different neutrino mass hierarchies to the ACDM model. What is the main conclusion drawn from these plots?
choices: The spectra for different hierarchies are easily distinguishable from each other.
The dynamical DE models show significant deviations from the ACDM model at low l values.
The spectra for different hierarchies as well as for ACDM are completely indistinguishable from each other.
The JBP model shows a much better fit to the CMB data compared to the CPL and logarithmic models.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure depicts the evolution of the DE EoS (w<sub>de</sub>) as a function of redshift (z) for CPL, logarithmic, and JBP parametrizations.  At high redshifts (z > 1), which DE parametrization exhibits the LEAST variation in w<sub>de</sub> between the three neutrino mass hierarchies?
choices: All three models show similar variations at high redshifts.
